intro: Siebera commutata, commonly known as the smoothleaf siebera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its smooth, elongated leaves and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
